instay.description: InStay is a smart hospitality ecosystem integrating IoT devices, Smart TV, and a remote-control system to enhance the guest experience and streamline property management. Designed for both tenants and owners, it offers intuitive control, energy efficiency, and secure device management within short-term rentals.
instay.problem: Guests face difficulty adjusting lighting and climate, finding essential information, and adapting to unfamiliar systems. Owners deal with wasted energy, device misuse, and limited control over property resources. InStay needed a cohesive, user-friendly solution that works seamlessly across devices while maintaining security and brand identity.
instay.solution: We designed a connected ecosystem uniting Smart TV, IoT devices, and a dedicated remote within a single interface. The Smart TV serves as an intuitive hub for tenants, while owners manage and monitor via an app. Through iterative prototypes, we refined clarity, reduced clicks, and maintained a sense of hospitality. The final UI features a minimal aesthetic, clear iconography, and a soft palette that conveys trust, innovation, and simplicity.

Its minimal design, tested through multiple prototypes, ensures intuitive use and complements any interior with five subtle color options.

ui.text: The InStay Smart TV UI turns the television into the guest‚Äôs central hub, unifying entertainment, property information, and smart‚Äëhome controls in a familiar environment. Guests can access streaming, local TV, Wi‚ÄëFi details, tourist information, house rules, and control lighting, climate, locks, and more‚Äîdirectly from the TV.

soltar.description: Soltar is an embodied interaction system that blends a wearable, haptic cues, and adaptive music to unlock emotional release through dance. For solo or group use, it eases social anxiety, strengthens body awareness, and syncs people through shared rhythm.
soltar.problem: Dance spaces can feel intimidating, limiting expression. People often lack guidance to align movement and emotion, and many can‚Äôt reach events. Soltar needed a portable, safe, and social experience that works anywhere‚Äîindoors or outdoors.
soltar.solution: I co-designed a wearable + app that uses vibration motors, IMU sensors, and adaptive music to guide movement in real time. Haptics build body awareness while the app tunes music and vibrations to intensity and goals. Prototyped with 30+ participants; supports solo or group modes with a minimal UI and mood‚Äëbased playlists.
soltar.categoryValue: UX/UI Design ‚Äì Wearable Tech, Embodied Interaction, Emotional Wellbeing

app.label: Application
app.text: Soltar is a wearable and app-based system that uses haptic feedback, adaptive music, and real-time motion sensing to guide users into an immersive dance experience‚Äîindividually or in groups. Designed to support emotional release and social connection, it helps overcome barriers like anxiety, self-consciousness, and lack of time for traditional dance events.

wearable.label: Wearable device
wearable.text: The Soltar wearable is a lightweight, body-mounted device integrating vibration motors, IMU sensors, and wireless connectivity to create an embodied guidance system for dance. Placed on the upper arms and wrists for optimal perception, it delivers adaptive vibration patterns that respond in real time to movement intensity, guiding rhythm and flow. The form factor is built from flexible fabric, secure fastenings, and a compact electronics module to ensure comfort, stability, and freedom of motion. Extensive iteration refined motor placement, vibration amplitude, and cable management, resulting in a design that is stable, perceptible, and comfortable for both individual and group dance sessions.

research.label: Research
research.intro: The development of Soltar was grounded in extensive exploratory research on the emotional and social dynamics of dance.

paths.title: Multiple investigation paths shaped the concept:
paths.caseStudies: Case studies of wearable haptic devices for movement, posture, and proprioception.
paths.literature: Literature review on somaesthetic design, body mapping, and emotional regulation through bodily awareness.
paths.feasibility: Technology feasibility testing with vibration motors, IMU sensors, and real-time music modulation via TouchDesigner.

research.outro: Over 30 participants took part in iterative prototype testing across seven dimensions‚Äîvibration placement, haptic patterns, IMU positioning, music adaptation, wearable comfort, UI clarity, and group experience.

outcome.title: Outcome
outcome.text: Our research allowed us to create a user flow supported by calibrated haptic feedback and adaptive music patterns. Iterative testing validated the system's effectiveness in facilitating bodily expression, reducing social anxiety, and creating authentic connections through synchronized movement.

credits.text: Project conceived and realized with Aranza Villarreal, Efe Eren Can Bakƒ±r, Kexin Ma, Sherif Rateb, Yifan Lu at Politecnico di Milano.

capsound.description: Capsound is a customizable keyboard platform that allows users to design, assemble, and upgrade their own keyboards. Instead of purchasing a fixed, pre-built product, customers can select individual components‚Äîcases, keycaps, switches, and PCBs‚Äîto create a setup tailored to their preferences. By focusing on modularity, reusability, and recycling, Capsound promotes a circular economy model that reduces waste and extends the lifespan of every keyboard.
capsound.problem: Most keyboards on the market are mass-produced with fixed designs, limiting personalisation and often forcing users to compromise on aesthetics, feel, or ergonomics. When a single component breaks or becomes outdated, the entire keyboard is often discarded, generating unnecessary waste. Enthusiasts who wish to build their own keyboards face fragmented sourcing, higher costs, and a lack of beginner-friendly guidance. A unified, sustainable, and accessible solution was needed.
capsound.solution: Capsound offers a centralised shop where users can purchase compatible keyboard components individually or as part of curated build kits. The platform‚Äôs modular system enables customers to repair, upgrade, or fully redesign their keyboards without replacing the entire product. By integrating recycling programs for old parts and offering educational resources for first-time builders, Capsound makes mechanical keyboard customisation both sustainable and accessible. This approach reduces material waste while empowering users to create a product that reflects their exact needs and style.
